"Basket" Formation New Ground Photos © 1999 by Linda Moulton Howe "Basket" wheat formation discovered in the early morning of August 6, 1999 at Bishops Cannings before the farmer erased it entirely with his tractor. 46.3 meters (152 feet) diameter. Aerial photograph © 1999 by Ulrich Kox. September 19, 1999 Bishops Cannings, Wiltshire, England Andreas Mueller, a student from Saarbruecken, Germany, and his colleague from Switzerland, Werner Anderhub, took the only ground photographs of the remarkable "Basket" formation before the farmer destroyed it with his harvester on August 6th at Bishop Cannings near Devizes and Roundway Hill . See Earthfiles August 15, 1999 for further information. Fortunately, not only were aerial and ground photographs taken before the wheat was cut down, but Andreas Mueller was able to make sketches and measurements. Below are ground photographs and Mueller's diagram of the crop formation's complicated lay.
Photos © 1999 by Werner Anderhub, Bern Switzerland.
